ClubFloyd Transcript:  
**_Zork I_ by Marc Blank and Dave Lebling**  
**_Zork: A Troll's-Eye View_ by Dylan O'Donnell**  
As played on ifMUD on April 3 & 10, 2016 The idea behind ClubFloyd is that each week at a pre-arranged time, a group of people meet online to cooperatively play a game of interactive fiction.   
  
Below is a transcript of _Zork I_ written by Marc Blank and Dave Lebling, and _Zork: A Troll's-Eye View_ written by Dylan O'Donnell. _Zork I_ was released by Infocom in 1980; it ranked 22nd and 41st in the 2011 and 2015 editions of the Interactive Fiction Top 50 of All Time, respectively. _Zork: A Troll's-Eye View_ is a short, fun game inspired by _Zork I_ that was released in 1998. You can learn more about the games, including how to download them, by visiting the IFDB pages: [Zork I](http://ifdb.tads.org/viewgame?id=0dbnusxunq7fw5ro) and [Zork: A Troll's-Eye View](http://ifdb.tads.org/viewgame?id=1ya4d9l464gpy7sh).   
  
WARNING! Below you will find a transcript of people playing these games, and it goes without saying that the transcript is full of spoilers. So, if you've never played these games, and think you might like to at some point, I do not recommend reading any further. Instead, you might want to return to the [interactive fiction page](https://allthingsjacq.com/interactive_fiction.html).  
**To skip directly to a particular game, click on its title:**  
  
[_Zork I_](https://allthingsjacq.com/intfic_clubfloyd_20160401.html#1-zork1) by Marc Blank and Dave Lebling  
[_Zork: A Troll's-Eye View_](https://allthingsjacq.com/intfic_clubfloyd_20160401.html#3-troll) by Dylan O'Donnell
